bibl.title: Photograph of a map of the Post Hospital, Columbia Barracks, Havana, Cuba, with annotations by Albert E. Truby, 1899

div1.head: Photograph of a map of the Post Hospital, Columbia Barracks, Havana, Cuba, with annotations by Albert E. Truby, 1899
div1.p:
C2
B3
This map is in the office of the A
Chief of Engineers
Ciudad Militar, Havana Cuba.
This is the left 1/3 of a map labelled
(in the upper right corner)
map of Camp Columbia, Cuba
showing
Barracks of 8th Infantry, 7th Cavalry
& 2nd Artillery
Buildings for Post Hospital, Veterinary
Hospital, Commissary and
Quartermarter.
Gen'l C.F. Humphrey B. F. Dickson
Deputy Quartermaster Supt. Barracks
G'ral, U.S.A. Construction
Chief Quartermaster
Div. of Cuba
1899
In the lower right of the
map it shows a house
in Buena Vista labelled
“Gen. Lee's old headquarters”
way lives = elevators
Borrowed & photographed April 3, 1941
by Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
I have the film of you
need more.
I am anxious to get a copy of the original.

This map (a tattered blue print) is in
the office of the Chief Engineer.
Ciudad Militar, Havana, Cuba
This photo shows only the left 1/3 of the
map.

In the lower right hand corner of the
map (not shown here) it says
“After original by
Willis E Ayres, Engineer & Drfts,
W.B. Ditmars, Del.,
Apr 29, 1901.

This is an 1899 map checked by
a survey of March 1901

I am anxious to get a blue print
of this whole map.

Shows artillery Barracks & Stables
Infantry ”
Officers ”
